most_active_tickets.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen

common_issues.title: LTM and Authentication Issues in Pieces OS and CLI
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with LTM functionality in the Pieces CLI and desktop application, encountering 404 errors related to the Gemini-Pro model.  Additionally, authentication problems are reported, with verification codes not being received.  Issues span across Windows and macOS platforms and various Pieces OS versions (11.3.6, 12.0.0).  Check LTM connection and model access.  Verify authentication server status and email delivery.

related_issues.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI
related_issues.text:
LTM not working in Pieces CLI
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces CLI, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Screenshot from CLI:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/949b363d-bbd3-4f3a-b128-5211ca2ef765)

Same question from a chat in Pieces Desktop instead:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d3e98a3-e311-46d3-acba-678e286a4bcd)

Pieces CLI doesn't seem to get the context from LTM.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
related_issues.text:
Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I haven't been online a lot because of personal issues. Yesterday I restarted pieces for the first time in weeks, and it said I needed to sign in before I can continue.
First the sign in link wouldn't work. Then I noticed there was a Pieces OS update too. After I clicked that update I got back to the same screen and the link would work.
So I entered my mail address and it said I should get a verification code, which never arrived. So I tried again later and still nothing happened. I decided to let it rest until today and try it again, but still the same result.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 12.0.0 Desktop and CLI Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS 12.0.0 on Desktop and CLI. Desktop app initialization hangs on Linux, login authentication fails on macOS, and CLI's LTM integration is broken on Windows.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and potential solutions across platforms.  Check logs, network connectivity, and authentication services.

related_issues.title: Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
related_issues.text:
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi team,

Yesterday (15th June 2025), a new pieces version got released on snap. The new version broke the installation completely and the Desktop application doesn't move past the first step of initialization itself. I thought it was a problem with my system, but I tried a fresh install on a completely different device and same behaviour was observed. Please let me know if there is a way to revert back to the older version till the time this issue gets resolved. Also, please let me know if any further details are required to assist you with the resolution.

Distro: Ubuntu 24.04
Arch: x86_64

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
related_issues.text:
Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I haven't been online a lot because of personal issues. Yesterday I restarted pieces for the first time in weeks, and it said I needed to sign in before I can continue.
First the sign in link wouldn't work. Then I noticed there was a Pieces OS update too. After I clicked that update I got back to the same screen and the link would work.
So I entered my mail address and it said I should get a verification code, which never arrived. So I tried again later and still nothing happened. I decided to let it rest until today and try it again, but still the same result.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI
related_issues.text:
LTM not working in Pieces CLI
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces CLI, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Screenshot from CLI:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/949b363d-bbd3-4f3a-b128-5211ca2ef765)

Same question from a chat in Pieces Desktop instead:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d3e98a3-e311-46d3-acba-678e286a4bcd)

Pieces CLI doesn't seem to get the context from LTM.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate LTM connection and model access issues impacting CLI and Desktop app (especially Gemini-Pro model 404 errors).
Troubleshoot authentication server and email delivery for login verification codes.
Prioritize Pieces OS 12.0.0 issues: Desktop initialization hang on Linux, login authentication failure on macOS, and CLI LTM integration on Windows.
Check logs, network connectivity, and authentication services related to the reported issues.
Gather more data on user-reported Pieces OS versions (11.3.6, 12.0.0) and platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux) to identify patterns and potential platform-specific bugs.
Improve communication with users awaiting responses (status:waiting_on_user_responses) to expedite resolution.
Consider adding more specific categories for 'app:cli', 'app:pieces os', and 'app:desktop application' to better track and analyze issues within each application.
Monitor the most active tickets (713, 759, 758, 752) and allocate resources accordingly to ensure timely resolution.
Analyze the common issues and their related tickets to identify potential underlying problems or code defects.
Develop a plan to proactively address the identified issues and prevent similar problems from occurring in the future.
Communicate updates and resolutions to affected users to improve transparency and satisfaction.
Implement better error handling and logging to facilitate faster debugging and troubleshooting.
Review and update documentation and onboarding materials to address common user questions and issues.
Consider implementing automated testing and monitoring to catch issues earlier in the development cycle.
Collect user feedback on the reported issues to gain further insights and improve product quality.
Prioritize bug fixes and improvements based on the frequency and impact of reported issues.
Allocate resources to improve the stability and reliability of LTM functionality across all platforms and applications.
Investigate the root cause of the authentication issues and implement robust solutions to prevent future occurrences.
Improve the user experience for login and authentication by simplifying the process and providing clear instructions.
Provide regular updates to users on the progress of issue resolution and planned improvements.
Encourage users to report issues and provide feedback to continuously improve the product and support operations.
Establish a process for triaging and prioritizing support tickets based on severity and impact.
Train support staff on common issues and troubleshooting techniques to improve response times and resolution rates.
Develop a knowledge base or FAQ section to address common user questions and issues.
Implement a system for tracking and analyzing support ticket data to identify trends and areas for improvement.
Regularly review and update support processes and procedures to ensure efficiency and effectiveness.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement in support operations by encouraging feedback and innovation.
Consider using a support ticket management system to streamline workflows and improve collaboration.
Automate routine tasks in support operations to free up staff time for more complex issues.
Set clear service level agreements (SLAs) for support ticket response and resolution times.
Monitor and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) for support operations to track progress and identify areas for improvement.
Communicate performance metrics and improvement initiatives to stakeholders to ensure alignment and transparency.
Recognize and reward outstanding performance in support operations to motivate and retain staff.
Invest in training and development for support staff to enhance their skills and knowledge.
Promote a positive and supportive work environment for support staff to improve morale and productivity.
Encourage collaboration and knowledge sharing among support staff to improve team performance.
Regularly assess and adapt support operations to meet changing user needs and business requirements.
Stay up-to-date on industry best practices and emerging technologies in support operations.
Benchmark support performance against competitors to identify areas for improvement and innovation.
Seek feedback from users and stakeholders on support operations to identify areas for improvement and innovation.
Continuously evaluate and improve support operations to deliver exceptional customer service and drive business success.
